posts.content:
Below are the details as they will appear in your next magazine.

Annual Rally and AGM Weekend 3rd - 6th May
Prices remain unchanged for camping and food.
Only a short drive from the M1 or M69 and close to Stanford Hall.
The venue is Victoria Farm, Highcross Rd, Claybrook Magna,
Lutterworth, Leicestershire, LE17 5AU

There are on site toilets and showers and food will be available in the farmhouse marquee from Friday evening to Monday, please see the menu.
Friday 3rd MAY
Gates open from 12 noon until 10pm. The barn and bar will be open in the evening along with a DJ playing a good mix of music.

Saturday 4th
Gates open from 9.30am until 10pm.
Swapmeet
If you have any VW parts, accessories or furniture you want to sell or
swap then please feel free to set up next to your pitch, if the weather is poor then there will be an area reserved inside the barn, from 10.00am
to 2.00pm.

Seedlings Activities
There are activities planned to keep the children entertained and full details will be listed in the barn, from 10.00am Saturday.

RESTORATION OF THE YEAR
If you have restored or had your van restored within the last 12 months then you are
eligible to enter for restoration of the year.
This does not have to be a complete restoration and it may be just
your interior, chassis or body work that needed improving; As long as
the whole van is to a good standard then why not enter it, you never
know you may come away with first prize.
Nominations for restoration of the year must be submitted by 2.00pm on
the Saturday. Please notify a member of the committee on the gate.

Tug-of-War
We hope to have a tug of war, get your friends together and form a team for some light hearted fun, this will take place during the afternoon with the times listed in the weekend program.

AGM
This will take place on Saturday at 5pm in the barn and will be
followed by the awards for van of the year, restoration of the year,
best paint etc.
Voting forms will be included in the welcome pack and should be
returned to the main gate by 3pm on Saturday.


Live Music
On Saturday night we hope to have a live band, please come along and enjoy a good evening’s entertainment.

Sunday 5th May
Cruise to Stanford Hall
The Farmhouse kitchen opens early for breakfast before the cruise.

Quiz
The family fun quiz will be held in the barn.
Please be ready in your teams for 7.30pm and don’t forget to bring a pen, teams can be of any age group, the more varied the more chance of winning.

Charity Auction
This year’s chosen charity is CALM a mental health charity.
The Campaign Against Living Miserably (CALM) is leading a movement against male suicide, the single biggest killer of men under 45 in the UK.

The auction will start at 9.00pm in the barn.
Please contact Eddy or Nigel if you have any items you would like to auction. We are looking for items that will help raise money for this year’s chosen charity. Quality items would be greatly appreciated!

VF Bar
Victoria Farm will be running a bar in the barn and this year will see a selection of real ales, the prices as usual will be very reasonable; Eddy & Jackie put a lot of work into
making sure everything runs smoothly during the weekend, so please
support the bar.

CAMPING
The camping weekend is for current paid up members, so please make
sure you have your membership card with you and that it is up to date,
if not then please renew in plenty of time.
Victoria Farm will be open for camping from 12.00 noon till 10pm on the
Friday and 9.30am till 10pm on Saturday. The cost of
camping is £15 per unit per night. A unit comprises of a van and two
adults and children are free. Extra adults are charged at £6 per
person per night. There is limited space for members to bring guests
but a maximum of two guest vehicles per membership number; these are charged at
£20 per night for two adults and must arrive with the member’s
vehicle.
There are a few hook ups left, please contact Eddy to check availability and to book.
Dogs are allowed on site but must be kept on a lead and exercised off
site. Please clean up after them.
Passes for Stanford Hall will be issued at the gate when paying for
your camping.
Entry for adults and over 14’s £12 children under 14 years free, please note passes will only be
issued to Splits taking part in the convoy, any other vehicle trying
to enter with the convoy will be refused entry by Stanford Hall and
this will disrupt the convoy, so if you don’t have a pass please use
the front entrance and pay at the gate, the prices are exactly the same.

Directions to Victoria Farm, LE17 5AU
Approaching from M69 Victoria Farm is approximately one mile east of
the Hinckley junction. Take the A5 towards Lutterworth for about one
mile. When dual carriageway starts there is a short hill, turn left
near the top onto the B577 for Claybrook. Victoria Farm is about 50
metres along this road on the left.
(Look for the club banner or flag!
Approaching from the M1 junction 20 take the A4303 signed Hinckley
till you come to the A5, and follow signs towards Hinckley; the High
Cross/Claybrook crossroads is about three miles from Lutterworth. Turn
right off the dual carriageway towards Claybrook B577 and Victoria
Farm is 50 metres on the left.

Stanford Hall
5th May
www.stanfordhallvw.co.uk
The club will have a marquee with Merchandise, Membership
and Van register and this will be in the usual place on the main drag adjacent to the entrance to the hall.
The club convoy will line up against the river and is a really impressive display, well worth getting up early to convoy to the show.
Dogs are allowed on the showground but must be on a lead at all times.
Admission is £12 for adults and children over 14, under 14’s are free.

A program listing all the activities and times will be in your welcome pack when you check in, please make sure your familiar with all that we have planned for you and we hope you have a great time.
So looking forward to this, Been a member for so long but have never attended, going to get involved this year.

slammed 56 wrote: ↑
Sun Mar 03, 2019 6:30 pm
So looking forward to this, Been a member for so long but have never attended, going to get involved this year.

If members require a valuation at Vic Farm on the AGM weekend.

These will be available on the Saturday mainly. (Possibly on the Monday too depending which valuers are available on site).

Please make contact in advance via valuations@ssvc.org.uk if you would like a valuation.

Evening Jim, payment made for valuation at the end of march, whats the next step? Do you allocate a time and place on the Saturday at Vic farm, or something more casual?
Cheers, Gary.

Max Last wrote: ↑
Tue Apr 09, 2019 6:48 pm
Evening Jim, payment made for valuation at the end of march, whats the next step? Do you allocate a time and place on the Saturday at Vic farm, or something more casual?
Cheers, Gary.
Bring the bus over for the valuation on the Saturday. Preferably in the morning.
No problem, the morning suits me perfectly, ta.

Better see if the bus starts, not been out since last summer.

Buzzers
I have been a full member on and off for 20 years and have never been to Victoria farm. My question is do I have to pay for my wife to come with me?

Price is £15 per unit per night, a unit being van, awning and two adults. Children are free. Entry for adults to Stanford Hall is £12 per person, under 14s are free.
I can't recommend this weekend highly enough, one of the highlights of the year.

Unfortunately I can only make it for the Saturday (daytime)......Will it be possible to buy spares during Saturday at VF please ?

I know that the club stand will be at Stanford Hall on Sunday, but I can't go

Thanks,

Phil.

Phil
You would need to contact Martin who runs the spares to see what he is planning on bringing up.
you should find his details in the club mag.

Thanks

Nige

Quick hijack to save creating another thread.

I'm heading down on Saturday to deliver an engine to another member. Due to work/family commitments I can't do it any other time for the foreseeable future, and my van will be off the road for a good few months until I sort another engine out.

Just checking it will be ok to pop in for a wee bit on Saturday evening to unload the engine? I'll be in a Saab 9-5 estate due to lack of van. I won't be hanging around long as I'll have to get back up to Newcastle the same day.

Cheers,

John
John, I'm sure that will be fine, just make sure you've got your membership card on you
